summary: Both products are serums, but they cater to different skin types and have distinct ingredients. GlowBoost Vitamin C Serum is suitable for oily and combination skin, while HydraGlow 5% Niacinamide Serum is suitable for normal, dry, and combination skin. They both contain hyaluronic acid, but GlowBoost has vitamin C, and HydraGlow has niacinamide.

points.verdict: Product A is more suitable for oily skin, while Product B is more versatile.
Product A has vitamin C, while Product B has niacinamide.

points.product_b: Improves skin barrier strength, Reduces redness and blotchiness, Provides long-lasting hydration
points.verdict: Product A is better for brightening and fading dark spots, while Product B is better for skin barrier strength, redness, and hydration.
Product A is cheaper than Product B.
